In this chapter we will consider some basic concepts of the relations that are called functions. A large variety of mathematical ideas and applications can be more completely understood when expressed through the function concept.

theorem.title: The composition of injections is an injection

statement.p: If f: A \rightarrow B and g : B \rightarrow C are injections, then g\circ f : A \rightarrow C is an injection.

theorem.title: The composition of surjections is a surjection

statement.p: If f : A \rightarrow B and g: B \rightarrow C are surjections, then g\circ f: A \rightarrow C is a surjection.
If A and B are finite sets, how many different functions are there from A into B?

answer.p: For each of the \lvert A \rvert elements of A, there are \lvert B \rvert possible images, so there are\lvert B \rvert\cdot \lvert B \rvert\cdot \ldots \cdot \lvert B \rvert=\left\lvert B \rvert^{\lvert A \rvert}\right. functions from A into B.
